briefdescription.para: Constant-valued expression.
Method expression that requires evaluation.
Boolean expression.
Arithmetic expression.
Root node of the evaluation tree.
Subexpression that may be referenced several times.
Reference to a subexpression.
Unresolved reference to an external group.
Post-processing of selection value.
Defines the type of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object.
Not.
And.
Or.
Xor (not implemented).
Defines the boolean operation of gmx::SelectionTreeElement objects with type SEL_BOOLEAN.
Addition (+)
Subtraction (-)
Unary -
Multiplication (*)
Division (/)
Power (^)
Defines the arithmetic operation of gmx::SelectionTreeElement objects with type SEL_ARITHMETIC.
Returns a string representation of the type of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection for which the string is requested
Pointer to a string that corresponds to sel->type. The return value points to a string constant and should not be free'd.
The function returns NULL if sel->type is not one of the valid values.

briefdescription.para: Returns a string representation of the boolean type of a SEL_BOOLEAN gmx::SelectionTreeElement.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a string representation of the boolean type of a SEL_BOOLEAN gmx::SelectionTreeElement.

sel
Selection for which the string is requested
Pointer to a string that corresponds to sel->type. The return value points to a string constant and should not be free'd.
The function returns NULL if sel->type is not one of the valid values.

briefdescription.para: Returns a string representation of the type of a gmx_ana_selvalue_t.

detaileddescription.para:
val
Value structore for which the string is requested.
Pointer to a string that corresponds to val->type, NULL if the type value is invalid. The return value points to a string constant and should not be free'd.

briefdescription.para: Selection value flags are set.

detaileddescription.para: If this flag is set, the flags covered by SEL_VALFLAGMASK have been set properly for the element.

briefdescription.para: The element evaluates to a single value.

detaileddescription.para: This flag is always set for GROUP_VALUE elements.

briefdescription.para: The element evaluates to one value for each input atom.
The element evaluates to an arbitrary number of values.
The element (or one of its children) is dynamic.
The element may contain atom indices in an unsorted order.
Mask that covers the flags that describe the number of values.
Mask that covers the flags that describe the value type.
Data has been allocated for the v.u union.

detaileddescription.para: If not set, the v.u.ptr points to data allocated externally. This is the case if the value of the element is used as a parameter for a selection method or if the element evaluates the final value of a selection.
Even if the flag is set, v.u.ptr can be NULL during initialization.

xrefdescription.para: This flag overlaps with the function of v.nalloc field, and could probably be removed, making memory management simpler. Currently, the v.nalloc field is not kept up-to-date in all cases when this flag is changed and is used in places where this flag is not, so this would require a careful investigation of the selection code.

briefdescription.para: Data has been allocated for the group/position structure.

detaileddescription.para: If not set, the memory allocated for fields in v.u.g or v.u.p is managed externally.
This field has no effect if the value type is not GROUP_VALUE or POS_VALUE, but should not be set.

briefdescription.para: method->init_frame should be called for the frame.
Parameter has been evaluated for the current frame.

detaileddescription.para: This flag is set for children of SEL_EXPRESSION elements (which describe method parameters) after the element has been evaluated for the current frame. It is not set for SEL_ATOMVAL elements, because they may need to be evaluated multiple times.

briefdescription.para: method->init has been called.
method->outinit has been called.

detaileddescription.para: This flag is also used for SEL_SUBEXPRREF elements.

briefdescription.para: Writes out a human-readable name for an evaluation function.

parameterdescription.para: File handle to receive the output.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value type of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection element to set the type for.
vtype
Value type for the selection element.
If the new type is GROUP_VALUE or POS_VALUE, the SEL_ALLOCDATA flag is also set.
This function should only be called at most once for each element, preferably right after calling _gmx_selelem_create().

briefdescription.para: Frees the memory allocated for a selection method parameter.
Frees the memory allocated for a selection method.

memberdef.argsstring: (FILE *fp, const gmx::SelectionTreeElement &sel, bool bValues, int level)
memberdef.name: _gmx_selelem_print_tree

briefdescription.para: Prints a human-readable version of a selection element subtree.

parameterdescription.para: File handle to receive the output.
Root of the selection subtree to print.
If true, the evaluated values of selection elements are printed as well.

briefdescription.para: Prints a human-readable version of the internal compiler data structure.

parameterdescription.para: File handle to receive the output.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the selection element subtree requires topology information for evaluation.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the subtree to query.

simplesect.para: true if root or any any of its elements require topology information, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the covered fraction of the selection can be calculated.

simplesect.para: true if the covered fraction can be estimated for sel with _gmx_selelem_estimate_coverfrac(), false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the covered fraction of the selection for the current frame.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection for which the fraction should be calculated.
Fraction of angles covered by the selection (between zero and one). The return value is undefined if _gmx_selelem_can_estimate_cover() returns false. Should be called after gmx_ana_evaluate_selections() has been called for the frame.

briefdescription.para: Declares gmx::SelectionTreeElement and related things.

internal.para: The selection element trees constructed by the parser and the compiler are described on the respective pages: Selection parsing and Selection compilation.
This is an implementation header: there should be no need to use it outside this directory.
